author: jongcapitalisk
content: I'm trying to use Web3.js https://github.com/ethereum/web3.js to connect to any Ethereum node to get some data without running my own node. Is this possible? I tried some random nodes but none of them work. I keep getting an error `Error: connection not open on send` are there any general purpose demo nodes I can use to test? What IP/port should I use?

author: jongcapitalisk
content: Having to sync 500GB of blockchain history just to do some quick checks is overkill for me

author: jongcapitalisk
content: I just want to connect to some random testnet node, get the latest block (for example) and print the result

author: jongcapitalisk
content: Or is it possible to run some kind of light node which receives new blocks/transactions but doesn't hold onto the history?

author: benjaminion
content: <@!520281592522997761>  Infura has a free tier that is perfect for this use case. See https://infura.io

author: benjaminion
content: (You are in the Eth2 section here, mind you. Web3js will not work with Eth2, so I am assuming that you want access to an Eth1 node.)
